result.execSummary:
The defendant Bill J. Toney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bill J. Toney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bill J. Toney was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.

Credit in the event of revocation: 2 days

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

miscConds.notes:
Any and all fines, costs, surcharges, and restitution (if any ordered) to be paid directly by the Defendant to the Richland County Clerk of Court. Defendant has 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court. Failure to pay in full within 60 days or failure to stay current on an approved payment plan will result in entry of civil judgment with interest and submission of the debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue State Debt Collection (SDC) Unit.

Defendant to keep the Clerk of Court informed of any change in contact information (address and/or phone number).

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Defendant Bill J. Toney in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Bill J. Toney.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank provides the court with a plea questionnaire form and informs the court that BT will be enters a plea on count 1 for 3 years of probation. Count 2 will be dismissed. Court review the plea questionnaire. Court colloquy. Court finds a factual basis. Defendant enters a NC plea. Attorney Harper and Attorney Frank heard. BT speaks to the court.


Count 1:
Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:11 AM Defendant Bill J. Toney in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant hasn't received the criminal complaint. Clerk provides the complaint to the defendant. Court reads the complaint and states max penalties. Court questions Def re his intent re counsel. Def states that he is working on getting an attorney and asks for more time to get an attorney. Court speaks about a preliminary hearing; if not waived, will be done in 20 days. Def states he has been appointed counsel by the public defenders office. Def waives prelim time limits (waives his right to have the prelim within 20 days) and states he plans to hire private counsel instead of a public defender. Court sets a status for April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Per the Public Defenders office: Mr. Toney does qualify for a public defender but will not have someone available on 04/13/22.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:26 AM Defendant Bill J. Toney appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand on behalf of Attorney Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. BT hasn't received the complaint. Court speaks about counsel. BT would like time to look for counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
